channel.title: Problem Solving on Today I Learned
channel.description: Recent content in Problem Solving on Today I Learned

item.title: Approach to Problem Solving
item.description: IOCE: Input, Output, Constraints, Edge Cases Identifying the input(s), output(s), constrains, and edge cases is important as we need to know what the inputs and expected outputs are for a problem, which also reflects my understanding of the prompt. Strategy(s): How can I get from my input to my output? A moment to be extra verbal and thinking out loud to brainstorm strategies After brainstorming the first strategy (write quick notes about it to remember), I can also come up with a second strategy, then identify trade-off.
